skill.name: reconnaissance-knowledge
skill.description: Comprehensive knowledge about network reconnaissance and service enumeration. Provides methodologies for port scanning, service fingerprinting, web directory discovery, and vulnerability identification. Includes best practices for structured data collection.
skill.summary: Comprehensive knowledge about network reconnaissance and service enumeration. Provides methodologies...
skill.author: CharlesKozel

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based knowledge skill containing only markdown documentation. It provides reconnaissance methodologies but has no executable code, no file system access beyond its own content, no network calls, and no environment variable access. The example commands shown are documentation for methodology guidance, not executable code.

content.value_statement: AI agents lack structured reconnaissance methodologies. This knowledge base provides step-by-step techniques for port scanning, service enumeration, and web discovery using common security tools. Agents learn to systematically identify attack surfaces without crossing into exploitation.
actual_capabilities: Port discovery using nmap and masscan
Web directory and file brute forcing
SMB, FTP, SSH, and database enumeration
limitations: Does not execute exploits or test vulnerabilities
Only provides methodology guidance, not tool installation
Requires pre-installed security tools on the system
Does not provide exploit code or payloads

use_cases.title: Systematic target reconnaissance
use_cases.description: Automate information gathering on targets during security assessments using proven methodology.

use_cases.title: Build pentesting agents
use_cases.description: Embed structured reconnaissance capabilities into custom AI agents for automated security testing.

use_cases.title: Pre-exploitation preparation
use_cases.description: Use layered reconnaissance approach to map attack surfaces before engagement activities.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Port Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform reconnaissance on target [IP]. Use nmap to discover all open ports and identify running services. Update state with your findings.

prompt_templates.title: Web Enumeration
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct web enumeration on http://[IP]. Use gobuster to discover directories and files. Identify technologies and potential entry points.

prompt_templates.title: Service Deep Dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform detailed service enumeration on port [PORT] of [IP]. Use appropriate tools like enum4linux for SMB or snmpwalk for SNMP.

prompt_templates.title: Full Recon Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Run complete reconnaissance on [IP]. Follow the layered approach: quick scan, deep scan, web enumeration, and service-specific checks. Output structured JSON summary.

output: Recommended next steps: Test /uploads for file upload vulnerabilities

best_practices: Use layered reconnaissance: quick scans first, escalate to deep scans when needed
Always save raw output files for later analysis and reporting
Format discoveries in JSON for consistent parsing and state management
Escalate through 3 layers before re-evaluating your approach
anti_patterns: Skipping UDP port scanning - many services use UDP
Only scanning top 100 ports - always scan all ports (-p-)
Using default wordlists only - layer with larger wordlists for depth
Moving to exploitation before reconnaissance is complete

faq.question: Which tools are required for this skill?
faq.answer: Standard Kali Linux tools including nmap, gobuster, enum4linux, and curl. Install additional tools if needed.

faq.question: Can this skill perform exploitation?
faq.answer: No. This knowledge base strictly covers reconnaissance and information gathering. Exploitation requires the exploitation-knowledge skill.

faq.question: How long should reconnaissance take?
faq.answer: Quick scans: 5 minutes. Comprehensive scans: 15-20 minutes. Adjust based on target complexity and time constraints.

faq.question: What output formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill emphasizes JSON output for structured data, making it easy to parse, store in state, and pass to other phases.

faq.question: Does this work on all network targets?
faq.answer: Designed for authorized penetration testing environments. Always ensure proper authorization before scanning any target.

faq.question: How does this compare to automated scanners?
faq.answer: This provides methodology guidance for AI agents. It complements automated tools by adding structured reasoning and layered approaches.
